questions.paragraph: A body that reflects incident light but is not considered a light source.
An animal whose eyes shine in the dark.
A method of communication commonly used between humans and animals.
A material that reflects light well .
A material that allows light to pass through it.
One of the simple optical codes that humans use for communication.
What is the importance of the mirror-like membrane in the back of the eyes of some nocturnal animals?
popup: It acts like a mirror, reflecting light as soon as it enters the eye. This helps gather a large amount of light, providing them with precise night vision.

questions.paragraph: Rami found a silver tea tray in his grandmother's house, but he noticed that it had a lot of scratches. Can Rami see his face clearly when looking at it? What is the reason for that?
popup: No; because the light rays will be scattered in different directions from each part of the scratches.

questions.paragraph: Your friend wanted to prevent light from entering his room. Give an example of a material he can use to block light from entering the window.
popup: An opaque material, such as curtains.

questions.paragraph: Writing is considered a code. Mention the reason.
popup: Because the arrangement of letters carries meaning and information.

questions.paragraph: What would happen if light did not have the property of reflection?
popup: We would not be able to see objects around us.
